text:
With AVX512, it should also be faster at handling non-vectorized remainders, e.g. benchmark on a dot product on 1024 vectors, one each of length 1,...,1024 in a random order:
```julia> function dotavx(a, b)
           s = zero(eltype(a))
           @avx for i ∈ eachindex(a)
               s += a[i]*b[i]
           end
           s
       end
dotavx (generic function with 1 method)

julia> function dotsimd(a, b)
           s = zero(eltype(a))
           @inbounds @simd for i ∈ eachindex(a)
               s += a[i]*b[i]
           end
           s
       end
dotsimd (generic function with 1 method)

julia> using Random

julia> x = randn(1024); y = randn(1024); Ns = shuffle(axes(x,1));

julia> @benchmark foreach(n -> dotavx(view($x,1:n),view($y,1:n)), $Ns)
BenchmarkTools.Trial:

           @inbounds @simd for i ∈ eachindex(x)
               s = max(s,x[i])
           end
           s
       end
